page.title: 05EDUCATIONAL PROVISIONS
page.content: The{village school}is a two-class primary school, accepting children from the age of five for full-time education. Children aged four plus are admitted for half day attendance until the beginning of the term in which they attain the age of five years, when they begin full-time attendance, which is from 9 a.m. to 3.30 p.m. At present there are forty-four children attending the school. When eleven, the children transfer to {Mullion Comprehensive School,}which is a journey of some ten miles by road. Transport is provided; the children being conveyed by bus. For A Level studies the children travel to{Helston {School.}Should they wish to continue studies they travel to the{Cornwall {College of Further and Higher {Education,}a distance of approximately eighteen miles from Coverack.
